channel.title: Basic deobfuscator
channel.description:
What sort of things do I need to do to make a basic BCEL deobber to get the hooks from the client? I read the list on a post made by qauters, but I need some examples on where to start.
Heres the list:
Removing IXOR's (not easy but not hard either) Simplifying shifts (easy) Removing unused code (int i = jl * 125 % 33423 kind of shit) (easy) Fixing control flow (easy)

Don’t try to blame your mistakes on the staff, it just makes you look like more of an idiot than you already are.

“easy huh? i would think not for you, if you assume a deobfuscator can only be written using bcel, or that it ‘gets hooks’.”

  1. you are the only idiot here
  2. you assume things and end up being wrong
  3. you are obviously doing your job wrong, because that is most definitely not what i posted

as for chrisn2323, it is common knowledge that he is… very very dim.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 10, 2009, 01:44:59 pm[/size][hr][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=409884.msg3024673#msg3024673 date=1257822028]

easy huh? i would think not, if you assume a deobfuscator can only be written using .net, or that it ‘gets hooks’.

^ NICE JOB OF EDITING MY POST YOU FUCKTARD STAFF

I saw this post before anyone edited it and it said the same thing chrisn2323 quoted, plus I checked the moderation logs back past the date you made that post and no staff edited any post of yours. i check back maybe 2 hours later, it was modified… however, it showed no ‘last edit’. my point is that some staff member (like yourself) did it in an attempt to 'censor it. what have we covered here?

ur so dumb, the post never says .net

no shit, you moron, some idiot staff modified my post.
[/quote]

It is IMPOSSIBLE for staff to edit a post and it not say ‘edited by: staff_name’ at the bottom of the post, even admins can’t do it. I suppose I could do it by editing the MySQL entry directly, but I didn’t. Bottom line is no staff edited your post, you posted the .net comment originally and then tried to blame your mistake on staff abuse, and failed.[/quote]

Simply, it’s not impossible. Just like it’s not possible for admin exploits by moderators in smf… Or using images with arbitrary code execution in firefox or other browsers, targeted to admin sessions to gain unauthorized access to smf or other, widely distributed sources, and servers.

You’re right mopar, you always are. I forgot you were all knowing. I should have precluded my insanity as reason for doubt. Clearly cherokee is the answer. This is my mistake and my fault.

item.title: Basic deobfuscator
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

pplsuqbawlz:

If you wanna save yourself some time in the long haul, start with ASM. Objectweb’s ASM is a much better library with a lot more functionality and extensibility. The one thing you may miss is the regular expression patterns… But that’s until you realize just how limited those are anyway… Opcode comparisons only go so far, what if I wanna see the value of those constant pushes? Or track a local variable etc? REGEX searching just doesn’t cut it.

Its trivial to port BCEL’s InstructionSearcher to ASM. The bonus is that you have Labels (fuck InstructionTargetters).

Read full topic

item.title: Basic deobfuscator
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:313381”][quote author=oksuper_ link=topic=409884.msg3024329#msg3024329 date=1257803705]
easy huh? i would think not, if you assume a deobfuscator can only be written using .net, or that it ‘gets hooks’.

^ NICE JOB OF EDITING MY POST YOU FUCKTARD STAFF
[/quote]

Haha, you must be an idiot. I saw this post before anyone edited it and it said the same thing chrisn2323 quoted, plus I checked the moderation logs back past the date you made that post and no staff edited any post of yours. Don’t try to blame your mistakes on the staff, it just makes you look like more of an idiot than you already are. :)[/quote]
LOL I remember being staff here! We had this nifty little thing that kept every revision that existed of a user’s post for us to look at! It’s nifty, oh how I miss being a staff member.

Is my sarcasm evident?

[quote=“quickmarch, post:1, topic:313381”]What sort of things do I need to do to make a basic BCEL deobber to get the hooks from the client? I read the list on a post made by qauters, but I need some examples on where to start.

Heres the list:

Removing IXOR’s (not easy but not hard either)
Simplifying shifts (easy)
Removing unused code (int i = jl * 125 % 33423 kind of shit) (easy)
Fixing control flow (easy)[/quote]

If you wanna save yourself some time in the long haul, start with ASM. Objectweb’s ASM is a much better library with a lot more functionality and extensibility. The one thing you may miss is the regular expression patterns… But that’s until you realize just how limited those are anyway… Opcode comparisons only go so far, what if I wanna see the value of those constant pushes? Or track a local variable etc? REGEX searching just doesn’t cut it.

Anyway, there’s a pattern for the “pointless math” as I call it. The variable is only assigned in execution, it’s never loaded. The calculation uses 1 variable that is from arguments. It’s generally a collection of bi/sipush|idiv|imod|isub|iadd|(1 iload of course) ending with istore. I don’t recall my pattern off the top of my head, and seeing as my hard drive’s heads are locked, im SOL on finding it for you.

Read full topic
